title: Hand hygiene opportunities in neonatal intensive care: a multicenter observational study to calibrate group electronic monitoring systems.
abstract: Observers were randomized to time and location across two different Neonatal Intensive Care Units (NICUs) to count hand hygiene opportunities (HHOs). Mean hourly HHO was lower at night and during use of precautions, and higher in shared rooms. HHO benchmarks can support implementation of group electronic monitoring systems in NICUs.
